Alrighty now guys to explain on my Plane of Existance. I never actually said that he successfully did it. I put in
"He then Locks on the the Solar Flare and intesifyes it spout and Directs its  raw Force Towards Unicron" Which means its raw force.
 The Energy let off. That can be manipulated, Not the Flare itself. It is a Tech that almost anyone with training can do. In other words it is just the energy from the Flare. And I said that he directed it to Unicron. In other words his target. He is taking energy and Directing it towards Unicron. Now I did not say that I automatically hit him. That is up to you guys to decide. But it changes the Battle Field. It applies the use of energy to a new level. 
  And of this whole fighting thing. Well if you guys want to then i can resign. it is that simple. I Play Dungeons and Dragons so I know the whole Psionics Class. It is the use of the mind and I know what the limits are.and if you remember in the post that I said " I just want your assurence on me being born."  He is not in the Bounderies of this univers yet. That is why he is getting a Remake. Turned from a Jet into a Beast warrior.thus giving him an physical essance in this world, Which would mean he needs to difuse his higher powers to be brought in. So his range on attacks will only be bout the max am mile and a half as long as he can picture what is going on.

Polar Claw <cycodrone@...> wrote:
You're talking like he usually has that power though
Airly. There's nothing to stop Primus from boosting
his power temporarily, as I said, but then doing some
internal damage as a result.  I know you guys are
trying to avoid modding here, but at the end of the
day, you can't have a realistic battle where two
deities are actively involved without both deities
manipulating things to their advantage. I'm all for
avoiding modding, but the thing is that here, if you
take a black and white stance with it, you'll make
this into a clash of the titans with kid gloves, which
will just look and feel rediculous, and totally
UNREALISIC. 

--- airly2000 <airly2002@...> wrote:
